text: well here in the center of Bucharest
these protesters have got what they
wanted earlier Romania's governments
cancelled its controversial decree that
would have shielded some public
officials who would abuse their office
from prosecution and it was these crowds
it was pressure from the streets which
forced the government's into a u-turn
but as you can see the protests are
continuing and now many of the
protesters are demanding that their
governments resides we want them leave
it's not enough just to cancel it they
did something very wrong and we want to
do them out you want the government to
resign yes
we're determined to resist to keep
fighting to keep fighting and until the
current government steps down we believe
that they have lost credibility not just
with the remaining people but really
with other countries around the world so
it's time for them to go well these are
the largest anti-government protests
Romania has seen since the fall of
communism over the last few days
hundreds of thousands of people have
been coming onto the streets
to accuse their government of
backtracking in the fight against
corruption and here on the square
they're actually projecting
anti-government slogans onto the
government building now the authorities
rejects that criticism as supporters of
the government's accused judges and
prosecutors and investigators of being
overzealous in the fight against
corruption but massive protests
have forced a retreat this is a victory
that people power Steve Rosenberg BBC
News Bucharest
